references.formattedCitation: Yarshater, Ehsan. Encyclopædia Iranica. London: Routledge & Kegan Paul, 1989.

description: Pasargadae/Batrakatash was an ancient Persian city and the capital of Cyrus the Great (559–530 BC). It remained the capital until Cambyses II moved it to Susa. The site is listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
